title: Pixel 5 running temperature
content:
Hi all,

Using a new Pixel 5. The phone isn't in a case, and isn't charging at the same time I use the apps. If I charge the phone with the supplied charger it heats up quickly.

During regular use e.g. browsing internet or YouTube app, the phone gets warm - but not hot, and doesn't throttle. After 10 minutes, the CPU is 30c and battery is 27c.

Netflix - after 10 minutes, the CPU is 36c and battery is 33c. Phone is running warm but not hot.

Using the below apps, the phone is hot to touch very quickly:

Discord - very quickly, CPU is 39c and battery is 35c.
Recording 4k - after 8 mins: CPU is 40c, battery is 36c. The phone seems much slower, juddering and has loading screens when launching apps.

When I tried to charge the phone after using Discord or recording 4k with the above temperatures, the battery % didn't increase. I had to unplug the charger and then plug it in again after a while to charge.

Does the high temperature disable the USB port?

Is the above expected behaviour? My previous device didn't have these temperature issues.

Thanks
